revised_title: Experimental Investigation of Viscous Flow Instability Between Rotating Cylinders
tldr: This study investigates the stability of viscous flow between rotating cylinders using an ion technique. The authors determine the critical Taylor number, wavenumber, and waveform of the disturbances. They also observe the growth and decay of vortices as the Taylor number changes. The results are compared with theoretical values obtained from the integration of exact equations for the linear stability problem. The findings provide insights into the behavior of fluid dynamics in rotating systems.
